data.title: Git remote management

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
#20999

Might be possible already, but it wasn't clear how to add a remote after hitting this:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/23226545/c9431b0c-f8ea-11e6-8c45-5b835f919e51.png)

I also often do the following to sync from upstream, I don't know if this is possible currently:

```bash
git checkout https://github.com/Tyriar/xterm.js.git
git remote add upstream https://github.com/sourcelair/xterm.js.git
git fetch upstream
git merge upstream/master
git push
```

data.title: Terminal links: Urls are cut off at %.
data.body:
While testing #21021

```
bash-3.2$ echo https://www.amazon.com/Dell%2BP2715Q
https://www.amazon.com/Dell%2BP2715Q
bash-3.2$

The url is cut off at `%`.

data.title: Is TFS SCM integration possible
data.body:
#20999

It's been a while since I used regular TFS but from memory:

- I don't think TFS has a staging concept
- TFS workspaces are readonly until you check out the files explicitly

Given these and more differences with git, would TFS SCM integration be possible?

data.title: Terminal links: query strings are cut off at =
data.body:
While testing #21021.

```
bash-3.2$ echo https://task.krumplr.com/signup?referral=51cfe998f397460200000001
https://task.krumplr.com/signup?referral=51cfe998f397460200000001
bash-3.2$
```

`=51cfe998f397460200000001` of the query string is not included in the link.

data.title: Terminal links: fragment identifier is ignored
data.body:
While testing #21021

```
bash-3.2$ echo https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/extensions/markdown/src/extension.ts#L50
https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/extensions/markdown/src/extension.ts#L50
bash-3.2$
```

The fragment identifier `#L50` of the url is ignored.

data.title: VS Code window crashed and I lost my code edits...what should I do?
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.1
- OS Version: Win10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. I was editing a .cpp file while debugging our C++ extension with the [Extension Development Host].

Bug: Seemingly randomly, a popup appeared that said the window crashed. All my unsaved edits were lost. Is there anything I can do to help get this fixed? I don't see any crash dumps or error logging being made. I'd prefer to avoid losing my code changes like this.

If our C++ extension is somehow causing the crash then we want to diagnose/fix the problem, but I don't know of any way our extension could be causing the window to crash.

data.title: Terminal links: Understand line and column information after a file path

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
While testing #21021.

tsc generates error messages of the following form:
```
[10:13:10] Error: /Users/me/Development/projects/vscode/extensions/html/server/src/modes/htmlMode.ts(36,31): Property 'findDocumentSymbols' does not exist on type 'LanguageService'.
[10:13:10] Error: /Users/me/Development/projects/vscode/extensions/markdown/src/extension.ts(50,36): Property 'com_mands' does not exist on type 'typeof 'vscode''.
```

The files are correctly linkified.  We should have a link detection extension that also includes the line and column information so that we can directly jump to the error by clicking the link.

data.title: Provide capability for Find to search only visible text
data.body: In a large document it can be useful to find a location by searching only the visible text when making use of document folding.

data.title: jsdoc autocomplete should prefer {Object} over {any} in JavaScript
data.body:
#21031

`any` is a TypeScript concept, `Object` is the most generic type in JavaScript which is more meaningful to non-TS devs:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/23225467/d8eb67e8-f8e6-11e6-9008-ee314dbebb0c.png)

data.title: jsdoc intellisense is triggered when you move the cursor to a line ending in /**
data.body:
#21031

For the following code:

```js
/**
 * Returns the minimum node from the heap.
 *
 * @return {Node} node The heap's minimum node or undefined if the heap is
 * empty.
 */
FibonacciHeap.prototype.findMinimum = function () {
  return this.minNode;
};
```

Steps to reproduce:

1. Put cursor at end of the second line (Returns the minimum...)
2. Press up, intellisense is triggered wrongly, making navigation with arrow keys difficult if you have block comments in your code. This also happens when navigating using page up/down.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/23225351/6822e72a-f8e6-11e6-9512-2f17c8f06079.png)

data.title: Configurable window title: relative file path or editor name
data.body:
While testing #20433.

When the editor is backed by a real file I'd like to see the relative file path. For editors that do not have a real/single file behind them such untitled files or settings, I'd like to see the editor name.

This could be either a new variable or support for simple conditionals `${activeFilePathRelative ? activeFilePathRelative : activeEditorName}`

data.title: Does /** @param */ have to be in intellisense?
data.body:
#21031

This looks a bit ugly to me and users would probably be seeing it an awful lot now:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/23224893/d97610ca-f8e4-11e6-9cfb-999349b07d16.png)

Does the feature have to be tied to intellisense? It seems to me this would be ideal:

1. Type `"/**"` on the line before a function, `" */"` is added after the cursor as before
2. Press <kbd>enter</kbd>
3. Intercept the enter key press and perform an atomic operation which transforms `/** */` into:

    ```js
    /**
     *
     * @param blah
     */
    ```

    That way it's a single undo to go back to `/** */`

The main reason I feel strongly about this is I never care about jsdoc unless I type `/**` and <kbd>enter</kbd> on the line before a function, in which case I *always* care about it. So why not just enforce the behavior there and keep it out of intellisense?

It's also kind of annoying to have the popup appear on typing /** as I'm forced to dismiss it if I want to go to another line via arrow keys.

data.title: Implement "Toggle skipping this file" for node-debug
Confusing 'current execution point' indicator

data.body:
Testing #20192

- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions: None

I would expect it to behave similarly to the line breakpoint decoration:
- a single click on the inline decoration to remove the breakpoint
- a right click on the inline decoration to show the breakpoint context menu

data.title: envFile doesn't work at launch config
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10.0-insider
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.4 Beta (16E163f)
- Node: 7.6

Steps to Reproduce:

1. add `.env` file into the project root
```json
{
  "version": "0.2.0",
  "configurations": [
    {
      "name": "Launch",
      "type": "node",
      "protocol": "inspector",
      "request": "launch",
      "program": "${workspaceRoot}/server/index.js",
      "stopOnEntry": false,
      "args": [],
      "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}",
      "envFile": "${workspaceRoot}/.env",
      "runtimeArgs": [
        "--harmony",
        "--trace-warnings",
        "--nolazy"
      ],
      "sourceMaps": false
    }
  ]
}
```

results in launch error
```
node --inspect=14795 --debug-brk --harmony --trace-warnings --nolazy server/index.js 
Node process error: Error: spawn node ENOENT
```
Changing this configuration to (ie load `.env` via `dotenv` module) work as expected:
```json
{
  "version": "0.2.0",
  "configurations": [
    {
      "name": "Launch",
      "type": "node",
      "protocol": "inspector",
      "request": "launch",
      "program": "${workspaceRoot}/server/index.js",
      "stopOnEntry": false,
      "args": [],
      "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}",
      "runtimeArgs": [
        "--harmony",
        "--trace-warnings",
        "--nolazy",
        "-r",
        "dotenv/config"
      ],
      "sourceMaps": false
    }
  ]
}
```

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Add column breakpoint with Hit Count 1 in example below
2. Start Debug
-> Breakpoint is hit twice

data.title: Column breakpoints are hard to place
data.body:
Testing #20192

- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.10.0-insider (256d76fed7947e7289f921df10658d7a69233b65, 2017-02-22T07:10:23.895Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions: None

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Add column breakpoint before `resolve()`
2. F5
3. Debugger stops on breakpoint
4. Breakpoint is moved after `.isDirectory()`

I could understand if it was moved before `!err`, because that needs to be evaluated before `resolve()` is called, but after `.isDirectory()` seems wrong.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9205389/23222791/e3f73a58-f8dd-11e6-88e4-cd4633febb53.png)

data.title: JSDoc suggestion
data.body:
testing #21031

- use JSDoc Auto Complete to enter a comment in a .js or .ts file
- place caret inside the comment
- trigger suggestions 

Observe: the JSDoc comment is still offered but does not really make sense (because nested comments do not work anyway).

data.title: Please add an additional option for "copy.eol", separate from "files.eol"
data.body:
Most of my work requires my files to have a simple LF as the eol character, but copy/pasting content in this format into other Windows apps such as Notepad or (more importantly) CMD, causes the lines to all run together as one single line.  It would be very handy, in settings.json, to specify something like this:

"files.eol": "\n",
"copy.eol": "\r\n"

so that content can be copied to the clipboard with a different eol than the file itself.

data.title: Unable to open 'settings.json': Cannot read property 'filterPreferences' of null.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Version 1.9.1 (1.9.1)
- OS Version: macOS 10.11.6 (15G1217)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open three editor tabs in that order: any.file, settings, another.file;
2. Focus must be in any.file editor;
3. Using hotkeys do fast combo for focus another.file editor - it should be very quickly!

data.title: Start Debug does not start current file (no launch.json)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.10.0-insider (256d76fed7947e7289f921df10658d7a69233b65, 2017-02-22T07:04:54.544Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|EditorConfig|EditorConfig|0.3.4|
|autofilename|JerryHong|0.1.3|
|vscode-simple-icons|LaurentTreguier|0.10.0|
|vscode-docker|PeterJausovec|0.0.11|
|azure-cli|chrmarti|0.3.0|
|regex|chrmarti|0.0.7|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.5|
|ghlink|dt|0.0.5|
|tslint|eg2|0.8.1|
|vscode-scss|mrmlnc|0.6.1|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|0.9.0|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.10.0|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|2.5.2|
|diff|rafaelmaiolla|0.0.1|
|vscode-open-in-github|sysoev|1.3.1|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Have a folder with several .js files and no launch.json
2. F5 while one .js is open
3. Another .js is launched

Not sure what might cause this, but I can reproduce in that folder.
